items.summary: The photo, taken during Russian President Vladimir Putin’s New Delhi visit last week, was held up by US Representative Sydney Kamlager-Dove as she rebuked US President Donald Trump’s stance toward India.

items.title: Private DTH revenue decline to moderate to 3–4% in FY26: Crisil
items.summary: Private DTH companies anticipate a slower revenue decline of 3-4% in FY26, supported by IPTV bundles and higher marketing income. Despite subscriber churn to OTT and DD Free Dish, DTH operators are expanding into IPTV, offering bundled services. Cost controls and reduced discounts are expected to stabilize margins.

items.title: Flaky utopia: Musk’s dream of technology freeing the world of work and poverty needs a reality check
items.summary: Elon Musk predicts that work will become optional and poverty will end as AI advances and humanoid robots proliferate. Sure, the labour market faces an upheaval. But that’s no reason to buy the utopian vision of someone with a vested interest in the technologies behind it

items.summary: As airlines grapple with stringent new regulations and a mounting demand for pilots and cabin crew, investments in simulation training are surging, highlighting a critical industry shift poised to reshape India’s aviation landscape

items.title: Rupee hits record low of 90.46 vs USD; RBI likely intervenes to limit losses
items.summary: The Indian rupee hit a new record low against the U.S. dollar, falling past 90.4675 due to the lack of a trade deal with the U.S. and corporate dollar outflows. The central bank reportedly intervened mildly to slow the currency's depreciation rather than defend a specific level.

items.title: AI's next big constraint isn't chips—And Morgan Stanley is calling it 'coin of the realm'
items.summary: The report highlights a 10–20 per cent power shortage for US data center developers over the next several years. Most new data center deals are now getting pushed to 2028–30, indicating heavy pressure on energy availability. Morgan Stanley expects shortages as early as 2026–27.

While this triggered the sell-off, most brokerages argue fundamentals remain intact, valuing the stock attractively despite working-capital stress and revised guidance. Analyst views remain divided but broadly constructive with improvement triggers ahead.

items.title: Penny stock jumps over 10% following relief rally on Dalal Street. Do you own?
items.summary: Bartronics India shares rose 10.1% amid a broader market recovery, despite a 57% decline since February. The company plans to rebrand and focus on Agri-Tech and Health-Tech, aiming to integrate financial services with agriculture.

This collaboration grants Air India passengers access to over 70 destinations across Southeast Asia, North Asia, and Australia via Singapore. Experts highlight Bank of India as a key pick, anticipating a re-rating to match private sector banks.

No major same-day cancellations have occurred, except for weather-related ones. The airline's entire network is reconnected, with reliability improving daily.

items.summary: Overall rural sentiment is highly optimistic, with three-fourths expecting incomes to rise next year, signalling sustained economic momentum.

items.title: India–US trade pact likely to be finalised by March; FY27 outlook strong, says CEA Nageswaran
items.summary: India and the US are nearing a trade deal, with Chief Economic Adviser V. Anantha Nageswaran expressing optimism for a March resolution. US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer acknowledged India's "best ever" proposals, despite ongoing disagreements on agricultural imports. Negotiators are currently in New Delhi for crucial talks on a Bilateral Trade Agreement.

items.title: Dixon Technologies shares bounce back 3% after three consecutive sessions of decline
items.summary: Dixon Technologies’ shares rebounded after a three-day fall, even as the stock remains in a broader downtrend with steep declines over the past months. Despite strong quarterly earnings and increased institutional holdings, technical indicators show the stock is oversold. This mix of weak price action and improving fundamentals suggests the potential for a short-term recovery.

items.title: Budget 2015-16: Fiscal push, infra boost, new black money law, a long-awaited corporate tax cut
items.summary: The Union Budget 2015-16 presented a roadmap for growth and reforms. It aimed to boost manufacturing and infrastructure. Financial inclusion and welfare for the poor were prioritised. Key initiatives included GST and the JAM trinity. The budget also focused on agriculture, entrepreneurship and social security. Reforms in financial markets and measures against black money were announced.

items.title: Sensex edges higher as Fed rate cut boosts global sentiment, rupee weakness caps gains
items.summary: The Sensex opened at 84,456.75 and was trading at 84,559.15 at 10:16 IST, up 167.88 points; the Nifty moved from its previous close of 25,758 to 25,809.30, gaining 51.30 points

items.title: Suven Life Sciences completes 100% patient enrolment for Phase-2b MDD trial ahead of schedule
items.summary: Conducted entirely in the United States, the randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial aims to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Ropanicant across 195 patients at 35 sites over six weeks.

items.title: India imports more Russian crude, but mix of buyers shifts
items.summary: India's oil imports from Russia are set for a six-month peak in December.  This surge continues despite U.S. sanctions.  Nayara Energy is significantly increasing its Russian crude intake.  Conversely, Reliance Industries is reducing its imports.  State-owned companies are now the primary buyers of Russian oil for India.  These trends suggest India is prioritizing discounted oil over political risks.

items.title: Delhi Air Quality Deteriorates: ‘Poor’ to ‘Very Poor’ levels recorded
items.summary: The AQI for the national capital, as reported by the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB), was noted at 287 at 8 a.m.

items.title: Bitcoin slips to $90K after brief jump above $94K as Fed’s cautious tone tempers rate-cut optimism
items.summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum fell nearly 3% as the US Fed’s cautious tone on inflation and employment dampened expectations of deeper rate cuts, pressuring crypto and major altcoins while market sentiment stayed volatile.

items.title: Wakefit Innovations IPO allotment: Here’s how to check status, GMP and other details
items.summary: Wakefit’s ₹1,289-crore IPO, subscribed 2.52 times overall, will finalise allotments on Thursday. Retail demand was strong at 3.17 times, while QIBs subscribed 3.04 times and NIIs 1.05 times. With a zero grey market premium, the stock is expected to see a steady, rather than sharp, debut when it lists on December 15.

items.summary: Corona Remedies IPO Allotment LIVE: Following the successful closure of its initial public offering (IPO), investor focus has now shifted to the allotment. Corona Remedies IPO allotment date is fixed as December 11.

items.title: Hindustan Zinc shares rise 4%, up nearly 9% in 3 sessions. What’s behind the recent surge?
items.summary: Hindustan Zinc shares surged 4% to Rs 532 as silver hit a fresh high, driven by a US Fed rate cut. The company, India's sole pure-play silver producer, benefits significantly from rising silver prices, which contribute substantially to its earnings and are expected to boost its valuation.

items.title: Record Date tomorrow: Last day to buy Mrs Bectors, Bharat Rasayan, and more ahead of stock split, bonus shares
items.summary: Today is the last opportunity to purchase shares of four companies before their record dates on December 12 for significant corporate actions, including stock splits and buybacks. Investors need to act fast to take advantage of these developments.

items.summary: Economists attribute the uptick to a fading base effect and higher gold and silver prices, even as core inflation remains firm at around 4.5%

items.summary: Stock Market Today: Nifty 50 opened at 25,771.40. It inched up 13.40 points or 0.05 per cent. The previous close was 25,758.00.

items.summary: The events show one of at least three instances where Intel has pursued deals that benefit Tan financially either by exploring bids for startups or investing in them directly through Intel’s investment arm, Intel Capital, said sources

items.summary: ICICI Prudential AMC’s IPO, valuing the company at Rs 1.07 lakh crore, puts it nearly level with HDFC AMC, reflecting its rise as a co-leader in India’s fast-growing asset management industry. With the largest equity AUM, rapid profit growth and an unmatched distribution network, the fund house commands premium valuations. But rich pricing, tighter Sebi rules and intensifying competition leave little margin for error.

items.summary: Launched in July last year with Pacific International Lines, the service has cut costs and transit time, driving sustained cargo growth

items.summary: Nifty’s struggle near record highs signals weakening momentum as FII short positions rise, the rupee hovers near 90, and progress on the US-India trade deal remains slow. With midcaps and smallcaps under pressure and technical indicators turning cautious, investors face heightened uncertainty despite steady domestic flows and stabilising earnings.

items.summary: Kaynes Technology India shares saw a rebound on Thursday after a sharp decline. Analysts at Nomura and Morgan Stanley maintain positive ratings, citing potential for growth and improved disclosures. The company faced scrutiny over accounting practices in its smart meters segment. Despite past challenges, future catalysts include working capital improvements and new business lines.

items.title: 1:1 Bonus Issue, 1:5 Stock Split, Rights Issue, Buyback: 5 Stocks to turn ex-date on Friday—Full List
items.summary: The ex-date is the day when a stock begins trading without the benefit of a corporate action. Investors buying the stock on or after the ex-date will not be eligible for the benefit. Eligibility is decided based on holdings as of the record date.

items.title: Divided Fed moves cautiously, markets bet on more easing in 2026
items.summary: The Federal Reserve delivered another rate cut but signalled a likely pause as policymakers await clearer labour and inflation data. Despite internal divisions, new projections show steady growth, easing inflation, and stable unemployment through 2026, though limited support for further easing. Market reaction remained positive, even as political scrutiny intensifies ahead of the US midterm elections.

items.title: Market lacks clear direction; largecaps favoured, AI wave poses risks to IT: Anand Tandon
items.summary: Independent analyst Anand Tandon says Indian markets remain directionless amid global macro risks, weak foreign investor returns, and uncertain earnings. He prefers largecaps over smallcaps, citing stronger positioning in metals, energy and AI-driven themes. Tandon warns that AI adoption poses long-term challenges for Indian IT’s traditional services model, making the sector structurally vulnerable despite near-term margin support.

items.title: Old economy sectors drive India's investment boom unlike US, position it as an AI hedge: Report
items.summary: The report noted that, unlike the US, where a sharp rise in spending on IT equipment and software is now dominating private investment, India’s capex story continues to be broad-based and rooted in traditional sectors

items.title: Prudential sells 4.5% stake in Indian asset management JV for $545 million ahead of IPO
items.summary: British insurer Prudential offloaded a 4.5% stake in ICICI Prudential Asset Management for approximately $545 million ahead of its $1.2 billion IPO.  Major investors, including Abu Dhabi Investment Authority and family offices, along with ICICI Bank, acquired these shares.  The fund house's IPO will see Prudential selling a 10% stake, with proceeds slated for shareholders.

items.title: Fed signals economic stability as US heads towards 2026 midterms
items.summary: The Fed’s latest projections indicate faster growth, easing inflation and stable employment heading into 2026, offering the White House a supportive economic backdrop despite limited scope for deeper rate cuts. While tariff-driven disruptions and affordability pressures persist, policymakers project cautious stability as the election cycle approaches.

items.title: Jhunjhunwala family, Madhu Kela queue up to pick ICICI Prudential AMC stake ahead of IPO
items.summary: ICICI Prudential Asset Management Company's mega IPO has attracted 26 marquee investors, including the Jhunjhunwala family and top HNI investor Madhu Kela. In a pre-IPO round, UK's Prudential Corporation has divested 4.5% stake for Rs 4,900 crore at the upper end of the price band at Rs 2,165 per share.

items.summary: The Fed’s statement on its decision also brought back language used in late-2024 to signal a pause in more rate cuts

items.title: Gold prices rise above Rs 1.3 lakh, silver hits fresh peak after US Fed cuts rates. What should investors do?
items.summary: Gold and silver prices opened higher on December 11 after the US Federal Reserve delivered its third consecutive rate cut. MCX gold February futures rose to Rs 1,30,259/10g, while silver March futures hit a record Rs 1,92,565/kg. Strong industrial demand, declining inventories, and geopolitical risks continue to support the metals, even as the Fed signals caution on future rate cuts.

items.title: Sensex jumps over 50 points, Nifty above 25,750 after US Fed rate cut
items.summary: Indian equities opened higher on Thursday, with both the Sensex and Nifty reversing a three-day decline. This uptick followed the U.S. Federal Reserve's expected 25-basis-point rate cut, a move anticipated to curb foreign investor outflows from the Indian market.

items.title: India's pension funds warn proposed bond rules may distort values
items.summary: Indian pension fund executives are pushing back against a regulatory framework designed to shield the $175 billion sector from fluctuations in the bond market. This proposed shift in valuing specific bond assets has sparked concern among managers, who argue it risks misrepresenting fund worth and complicating investor decisions.

items.title: Park Medi World IPO Day 2: GMP slips to 9%; check subscription status, review and key highlights
items.summary: Park Medi World IPO: The issue is commanding a grey market premium of ₹14, or roughly 9% above its ₹162 issue price, hinting at a possible listing around ₹183–184. The premium has eased from about 13% earlier, indicating a mild dip in grey market interest.

items.title: Wakefit Innovations IPO allotment date likely today. GMP, steps to check share allotment status online
items.summary: Wakefit Innovations IPO allotment date is likely today, December 11. Investors can check Wakefit Innovations IPO allotment status online through the websites of BSE and the IPO registrar. MUFG Intime India is the IPO registrar of Wakefit Innovations.

items.title: Fed resumes balance-sheet expansion to ease repo market liquidity strains
items.summary: The Federal Reserve is resuming Treasury bill purchases to ease liquidity strains in US money markets, responding to rising repo rates and tightened funding conditions. The move aims to stabilise short-term markets, maintain control over interest rates, and prevent year-end volatility.

items.title: A simple 5-step financial plan that actually works
items.summary: &nbsp;Financial success requires five simple steps: term insurance for earners, family health coverage, NPS for retirement, children's savings schemes, and a six-month emergency fund. These basics cover 99% of financial planning.&nbsp;

items.title: Adani Enterprises shares in focus as Rs 25,000-crore rights issue ends oversubscribed
items.summary: Adani Enterprises shares: Adani Enterprises’ ₹25,000-crore rights issue closed with strong demand, ending 108% subscribed. The public portion saw even higher interest at 130%, while promoters fully subscribed to their entitlements—signalling broad investor confidence in the company’s fundraising effort.

items.title: Coca-Cola appoints Henrique Braun as next CEO, James Quincey becomes executive chairman
items.summary: Braun, 57, has over three decades of experience at Coke, having led operations across Latin America, Greater China, and South Korea, and managed supply chain, marketing, innovation, and bottling operations.

items.title: Kaynes Tech could turn attractive, metals too pricey; NBFCs favoured over Banks: Dipan Mehta
items.summary: Elixir Equities’ Dipan Mehta says Kaynes Tech may become attractive once volatility settles, given its strong industry dynamics and expansion plans. He remains positive on metal stocks but warns valuations are rich and better bought on corrections. Mehta prefers leading NBFCs like Bajaj Finance, Chola and Muthoot over banks or small finance lenders due to competition and unsustainable long-term margins.

items.summary: MCX gold February contracts were 0.60% up at  ₹1,30,575 per 10 grams around 9:45 am, while MCX silver March contracts were 2.42% up at  ₹1,93,300 per kg at that time after hitting a record high of  ₹1,93,452 per kg.

items.title: Why 2026 will be another big year for luxury housing, according to Anuj Puri
items.summary: India's luxury housing market is set for a strong 2026. High-value home sales and price appreciation continue. Affluent buyers are driving demand for premium and ultra-premium properties. The commercial office sector is also experiencing steady growth. This trend is fueled by India's expanding economy and growing population of high-net-worth individuals. Real estate remains a compelling asset class.

items.title: India’s thali costs fall sharply on cheaper vegetables, pulses; prices likely to stay soft until March: Pushan Sharma, Crisil
items.summary: Crisil’s Pushan Sharma says India’s home-cooked thali cost fell 13% in November due to sharp declines in onion, tomato, potato and pulse prices driven by strong output and higher imports. Prices are likely to stay soft through early 2026, but lower sowing could push costs up from March. While consumers benefit, rural incomes are under pressure amid weak agricultural GDP.

items.title: ETMarkets Smart Talk| India’s IPO boom far from over: $20 billion pipeline seen in 2026, explains Maulik Patel
items.summary: India's capital markets are poised for a strong 2026, with IPO momentum expected to continue and an estimated $20 billion in fundraising. Robust domestic liquidity, rising retail participation, and improving governance are driving primary market strength. Marquee companies are expected to list, solidifying India's position as a vibrant IPO destination.

items.title: US Fed delivers 3rd rate cut in a row. What does it mean for Indian stock market?
items.summary: The US Federal Reserve cut the federal funds rate by 25 basis points to 3.50–3.75% on December 11, marking its third consecutive reduction. While the Fed signalled only one more cut in 2026, market expectations diverge, with CME FedWatch data showing a 77% probability of two additional reductions. Uncertainty persists over the policy outlook and its global impact.

items.title: Eternal shares tumble 21% from October peaks. Can investors buy this dip?
items.summary: Eternal, India’s largest quick-commerce player, has slipped 21% from its October peak, falling in 24 of 37 sessions after Q2 results triggered sustained selling. Analysts say fundamentals remain solid, but technical indicators show continued pressure with no confirmed reversal. Traders are watching key support zones to assess whether the correction opens an entry opportunity or if more downside remains.

items.title: Google for Startups Hub launches in Hyderabad's T-Hub: Free spaces for a year, training for founders — What's inside?
items.summary: The dedicated Google-branded space in Hyderabad will house scores of new startups, becoming the first Google for Startups Hub set up by the tech giant as part of Telangana’s broader incubation and innovation ecosystem.

items.title: Nephrocare Health IPO Day 2: GMP improves but subscription demand remains weak. Should you apply?
items.summary: Nephrocare Health Services’ Rs 871-crore IPO has seen a muted initial response despite an improving grey market premium. Strong financial growth, expanding international operations and rising margins support its prospects, though dependence on PPP contracts and hospital-based clinics poses risks. SBI Securities recommends subscribing at the cut-off price.

items.title: KSH International to launch Rs 710 crore IPO on December 16. Check price band, issue size, other details
items.summary: KSH International is set to open its Rs 710-crore IPO on December 18 at a price band of Rs 365–384 per share, combining a Rs 420-crore fresh issue with a Rs 290-crore offer-for-sale. Backed by SEBI’s August approval and a revised offer size, the magnet winding wire maker plans to use the proceeds for debt repayment, machinery expansion at its Supa and Chakan plants, and a rooftop solar project. The anchor book opens on December 15, allotment is due on December 19, and trading will begin on December 23.

items.summary: Corona Remedies IPO GMP today: According to market observers, shares of the company are available at a premium of  ₹270 in the grey market today

items.title: Vijay Kedia doubles money in 1 year, but this time investment isn't in a hidden smallcap stock
items.summary: Ace investor Vijay Kedia has doubled his money in a year—not through a smallcap multibagger, but via a silver ETF as the metal hit record highs. Despite the windfall, he’s keeping his precious metals allocation limited, citing long historical cycles of underperformance. Silver’s rally, driven by supply deficits and rising industrial demand, marks a rare shift in Kedia’s stock-focused strategy.

items.title: IndiGo flight status today: Check IndiGo cancelled flights at major Indian airports on December 11
items.summary: IndiGo flights cancelled status: On Thursday, IndiGo flights were cancelled at the Goa and Chennai Airports as the crisis continued for the tenth consecutive day. IndiGo cancelled multiple flights at the Ahmedabad and Bengaluru airports on Thursday too. Seven flights were cancelled at the Goa airport today and 36 at the Chennai airport. The crisis-hit airline has also announced travel vouchers worth Rs 10,000 to severely impacted customers between December 3 to December 5

items.title: Zee Laboratories promises cheap alternatives - but there's a catch
items.summary: Zee Laboratories’ drugs have failed at least 86 quality tests by Indian regulators, and the company has faced multiple court cases, reporting by The Bureau of Investigative Journalism (TBIJ) and the Thomson Reuters Foundation found.

items.title: Paramount launches hostile takeover bid for Warner Bros Discovery, topping Netflix’s offer
items.summary: Paramount’s move bypasses Warner executives, appealing directly to shareholders with more cash and a promise to buy all of Warner’s businesses, including cable operations that Netflix does not want.

items.title: China’s record $1.1 trillion trade surplus masks a demand weakness that a stronger yuan could address
items.summary: China’s eye-popping trade surplus shows how resilient its exports have proven in the face of US tariffs, but its economy suffers from weak consumption despite a demand stimulus. Letting the yuan rise would boost imports, help its people lead better lives and reassure trade partners.

items.title: "Damaging India, Hurting America": US Representative sounds alarm on Trump's tariff, immigration policy
items.summary: US lawmakers highlight trade tariff challenges and immigration policy issues affecting both nations. Concerns are raised about India's economic impact and American businesses. Additionally, US representatives express unease regarding India's close ties with Russia and China. H-1B visa fees are also discussed as a point of contention. Efforts are underway to strengthen the US-India partnership.

items.title: Mexico approves tariff hikes on imports from India, China, and other Asian countries
items.summary: Mexico's Senate has greenlit significant tariff increases, potentially reaching 50%, on imports from China and other Asian nations starting in 2026. This move, aimed at strengthening domestic industries, will impact goods like autos, textiles, and steel from countries without trade agreements. Business groups and affected governments have voiced their opposition to the new duties.

items.title: Coca-Cola names new CEO, Henrique Braun to lead company as James Quincey steps down amid tepid demand
items.summary: The change in leadership at Coca-Cola comes as packaged food companies try to adjust their strategies to consumers looking for healthier and more affordable drinks and snacks.

items.title: Mint Quick Edit | Big Tech’s mega pledges should help ease Indian anxiety over capital outflows
items.summary: Amid a pall of gloom cast by stock market outflows and a sliding rupee, India's FDI outlook has brightened as Amazon and Microsoft commit billions to our economy. Last year’s crash in net FDI will hopefully end up as no more than a blip.

items.title: Daily average train services rise to 11,740 post-Covid-19 rationalisation from pre-pandemic level of 11,283 daily trains
items.summary: Indian Railways is running 164 Vande Bharat chair car trains. The introduction of new services depends on various factors. A sleeper version of the Vande Bharat train is being developed with advanced safety features. Two such rakes are currently undergoing trials. This development aims to enhance passenger travel and safety across the network.

items.title: IndiGo cuts Q3 capacity, revises revenue guidance after flight disruptions
items.summary: The airline revised its capacity growth from high-teens to high single- to early double-digit percentages, while unit revenue is expected to see mid-single-digit moderation instead of flat growth.

items.title: How hubris turned IndiGo success into chaos
items.summary: IndiGo, once lauded for its punctuality, faces widespread flight cancellations and delays. This disruption follows a dispute with regulators over new pilot flying hour rules. The airline's rapid expansion and lean operational model left no room for such changes. IndiGo's strategy to leverage its reputation has led to a regulatory concession, but the long-term impact on its dominance remains uncertain.

items.title: PFRDA widens investment rules, allows pension funds to invest in top 250 stocks and commodity ETFs
items.summary: The regulator has also approved investments in gold and silver ETFs, enabling exposure to commodities for the first time

items.title: Stock Market Live Updates 11 December 2025: Sensex, Nifty rebound as bank and auto stocks lift markets
items.summary: Sensex, Nifty, Share Prices Live Updates: Find here all the highlights related to Sensex, Nifty, BSE, NSE, share prices and Indian stock markets for 11 Dec 2025

items.title: Divided Fed cuts rates, hints at a pause and just one cut next year as growth rebounds
items.summary: With incomplete economic data after a lengthy government shutdown, the Fed expects inflation to ease to around 2.4% next year even as growth strengthens.

items.title: DGCA clampdown and flight cuts may deepen IndiGo’s financial hit, analysts warn
items.summary: Despite a 10% cut in IndiGo's daily flights ordered on Tuesday, the airline may find it challenging to keep costs under control, given that it still needs to hire more pilots, a spot of bother for investors.

items.title: Offers from India best-ever: USTR on proposed bilateral trade agreement
items.summary: United States trade officials report receiving unprecedented offers from India on a proposed bilateral trade agreement. Negotiators are currently in New Delhi for further discussions. While progress is noted, some resistance exists regarding specific agricultural products and meats. Both nations aim to finalize the initial phase of the agreement, with trade experts advising caution on agricultural concessions.

items.title: IndiGo’s 10% capacity cut won’t spike fares, but expansion plans take a hit
items.summary: IndiGo faces a 10% capacity cut, impacting its expansion plans with an effective reduction of only 70 flights. This directive follows thousands of cancellations, leading to intensified DGCA scrutiny and on-site inspections. While fares may see mixed impacts, rival airlines caution about their ability to absorb the demand gap.

items.title: Fixed deposit growth finds its key driver in rural incomes
items.summary: Savings deposits in rural centres also posted a robust 10% increase, the fastest pace in six quarters. Experts attribute this shift to rising rural incomes while growth in the metro areas appears to be losing momentum as financially savvy investors increasingly divert funds into higher-yielding avenues such as mutual funds and equities.

items.title: Oracle Posts Weak Cloud Sales, Raising Fear of Delayed Payoff
items.summary: Oracle Corp. posted disappointing cloud revenue, suggesting it will take longer than expected for the company’s recent huge AI bookings to pay off.

items.title: Trump says Fed rate cut should have been at least 50 bps — 'rates should be lowest in the world'
items.summary: Speaking to reporters on Wednesday after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's speech following the Fed rate cut, President Donald Trump said that the 25 bps cut was ‘rather small’ and asserted that it ‘could have been doubled, at least doubled’.

items.title: One in five Vodafone Idea users inactive, finds study
items.summary: Vodafone Idea's reported subscriber numbers mask a significant portion of inactive users, impacting its average revenue per user and usage metrics. While the company has invested in network improvements and seen subscriber churn drop, a new study suggests its active paying base is smaller than reported, distorting key performance indicators compared to rivals.

items.title: Trai moots up to 55% cut in backhaul spectrum fees to reduce telcos' cost
items.summary: Telecom operators may soon see significant cost reductions. The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India has recommended slashing backhaul spectrum prices by up to 55%. This move aims to improve service quality and boost the use of backhaul carriers. The regulator is shifting to a uniform rate for spectrum pricing. This change will offer substantial financial relief to all telecom companies.

items.title: PHWR makers may build key parts for small modular reactors
items.summary: Indian industries are set to manufacture critical equipment for Small Modular Reactors. This initiative aligns with the 'Make in India' program. Companies with technical support from Bhabha Atomic Research Centre will produce components like special steel and pumps. Private sector participation will be through EPC contracts.

items.title: US Buys Own Boeing 737 Fleet to Speed Trump’s Deportation Push
items.summary: The US government will buy six Boeing Co. 737 jets to carry out deportation flights, expanding the administration’s efforts to ramp up the removals of people living in the country without legal status.

items.title: 'Systemic' issues behind Air India flights without Permit
items.summary: Air India's internal probe found systemic failures led to an aircraft flying eight scheduled flights without a valid license. The Continuing Airworthiness Management Organisation approved the flights despite a senior manager flagging the expiry. This incident raises serious questions about the airline's safety culture. Immediate measures are being implemented to prevent recurrence.

items.title: Apple to open fifth India store in Noida
items.summary: Apple is opening its fifth store in India, located in Noida's DLF Mall of India, marking its third store opening this year. This expansion underscores India's position as Apple's third-largest market. The new store, the third largest in India, will offer the full product line, customer support, and 'Today at Apple' sessions, anticipating significant customer turnout.

items.title: India slams China-led investment plan at WTO
items.summary: India has raised concerns at the World Trade Organization regarding a China-led proposal for an investment facilitation agreement. New Delhi argues that discussions on investment are outside the WTO's trade agreement framework. India emphasizes that such plurilateral agreements should remain exceptions, not the norm.

items.title: RBI may maintain repo rate at 5.25% through FY27: Fitch
items.summary: The commentary from BMI comes amid many economists and bond-market experts in India factoring in a further quarter percentage point reduction in policy rates, lowering terminal rate expectations to 5% in the current easing cycle after RBI looked past a sharply retreating rupee to deliver a rate cut last Friday.

items.title: Disruptions were not deliberate: IndiGo Chairman
items.summary: In a recent statement, Vikram Singh Mehta, chairman of IndiGo, addressed concerns about the ongoing flight disruptions. He clarified that the airline's board is actively collaborating with management to establish new pilot rest guidelines. Mehta reassured passengers that the recent cancellations were not intentional, attributing them instead to a combination of unforeseen internal and external factors.

items.title: Auditor flags lapses in Apple GCC's data backup, audit trails
items.summary: Apple's India operations facility has drawn auditor attention in its initial year. SR Batliboi & Associates highlighted issues with daily book backups and audit trails. The company has since implemented systems to meet legal requirements. These findings relate to Apple Operations India's support for the parent company's global activities. The facility procures equipment and employs engineers for R&D.

items.title: EU, US trade pacts progressing, says Piyush Goyal
items.summary: India's trade talks with the European Union and the United States are moving forward. Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal expressed confidence in early agreements. A US team is currently in New Delhi for discussions. Negotiations with Chile and Oman are also nearing completion. India is also pursuing trade pacts with Qatar and Israel.

items.title: Amid IPO boom, lawyers with capital markets exposure in demand
items.summary: Law firms are hiring more capital markets lawyers. This is driven by a rise in initial public offerings and other fundraising activities. Demand for equity offering specialists is growing as multinational companies plan to enter Indian markets. Successful listings have encouraged global groups to consider listing local operations. This trend is expected to continue.

items.title: Tipplers swap shots for pints as states shake up liquor laws
items.summary: Tipplers in Assam, Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra, West Bengal, and Meghalaya are choosing beer over hard spirits. This shift follows changes in taxation and retail expansion. Beer sales have surged significantly in these states. This trend indicates a move towards more moderate alcohol consumption and increased government revenue.

items.title: ReNew Power to raise $800 mn to refinance debt
items.summary: ReNew Power is raising $800 million through a five-year loan, with Societe Generale, Standard Chartered, and SMBC acting as lead banks. This significant borrowing, likely to be priced next quarter, will be used to refinance operational projects, aiming for a rate of 350-400 basis points over SOFR.

items.title: Four top refiners turn to Russia oil; Reliance Industries stays away
items.summary: Indian refiners are actively buying discounted Russian crude. Four of the seven largest processors are now sourcing non-sanctioned barrels. This comes as Reliance Industries avoids Russian oil to steer clear of sanctions. Imports are expected to continue at a reduced level into next year. Russian crude is currently priced attractively.

items.title: Parliament committee recommends reducing time for forest, environmental clearances for coal projects
items.summary: The committee also suggested streamlining process for public consultation and clearances from Gram Sabha to avoid delays.

items.title: Petronet LNG secures Rs 12,000 crore loan for petrochem project
items.summary: Petronet LNG has secured a significant ₹12,000 crore loan. State Bank of India and Bank of Baroda are providing the funds. This financing will primarily support Petronet's petrochemicals project. It will also cover other capital expenditure needs. The agreement follows a competitive bidding process. Petronet is India's largest LNG importer. It operates regasification terminals in Dahej and Kochi.

items.title: Propel to invest ₹300 crore in EV segment
Nestle India eyes massive rural growth, premiumisation in cities
items.summary: Nestle India is targeting significant growth in rural markets, which currently contribute only 15% of its revenue compared to other FMCG companies. The company plans to leverage its popular brands with affordable pack sizes to tap into the faster-growing rural economy. Simultaneously, Nestle will focus on premiumisation in urban areas for categories like chocolates and coffee.

items.title: New labelling rule coming soon: Clothes, home linen may have to tag care, origin, fabric details
items.summary: India is set to implement new mandatory labelling rules for apparel and home textiles, requiring manufacturers to disclose fibre content, origin, and care instructions. This move aims to align with global standards, promote recycling, and protect consumers from misleading claims. The initiative is part of a broader plan to boost the textile waste value chain and enhance consumer awareness.

items.title: Oil Ministry readies formula for new IOC board maths
items.summary: The Oil Ministry is planning a significant overhaul of Indian Oil Corporation's board. Three director positions are set to be eliminated as part of an organizational revamp. This move aims to consolidate responsibilities and reduce leadership layers within the company. The restructuring comes as public sector enterprises face pressure to improve efficiency. IOCL's top leadership reconfiguration could impact its performance.

items.title: IndiGo Chairman Vikram Singh Mehta hits back as crisis rocks India’s biggest airline
New Century Sofa India inks 2.72 lakh sq ft lease at IndoSpace Industrial Park
items.summary: IndoSpace has leased 2.72 lakh sq ft to New Century Sofa India at its Oragadam II Industrial Park. This deal underscores IndoSpace's accelerated investment in Tamil Nadu, a growing hub for manufacturing, and reflects strong demand from various sectors for Grade-A logistics facilities.

items.title: ADB lifts India's FY26 growth forecast to 7.2%
items.summary: The Asian Development Bank has raised India's growth forecast for the current financial year to 7.2%, citing stronger-than-expected second-quarter performance driven by robust domestic consumption. Despite an unfavorable base effect for 2026-27, policy measures are expected to offset potential drags, supporting continued economic expansion.

items.title: From passenger unit to capacity change — IndiGo cuts Q3 guidance amid flight cancellations
items.summary: From passenger unit to capacity change — India's largest airline, IndiGo, on 10 December 2025, announced to cut its October-December quarter (Q3) guidance for the financial year ending 2025-26 amid widespread flight cancellations caused by crew rostering norms.&nbsp;

items.title: RBI talks to banks on uniform fee disclosure, removal of overlaps
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India is actively engaging with banks to bring consistency to service charge disclosures and eliminate duplicate fees. This initiative, which comes on the heels of state-run banks lifting penalties for not maintaining minimum average balances, seeks to simplify the charges presented to customers.

items.title: Unilever sees 'massive opportunities' in India, citing GST cut and high GDP growth
items.summary: Unilever CEO Fernando Fernandez sees "massive" opportunities in India, citing high GDP growth and recent GST reductions. He believes the company and its Indian arm, Hindustan Unilever, will be primary beneficiaries of a more dynamic economic environment. Fernandez highlighted significant growth potential across various income segments in India.

items.title: Tata Steel announces growth plan for India, confirms Thriveni stake buy
items.summary: Tata Steel unveiled its next growth phase in India, including a five-fold capacity expansion at Neelachal Ispat Nigam to 4.8 million tonne. The company will also establish rolling facilities at Meramandali, acquire a 50.01% stake in Thriveni Pellets, and partner with Lloyd Metals and Energy for mining and steelmaking ventures.

items.title: Big deal: TCS strikes its largest acquisition ever, buys Coastal Cloud for $700 million
items.summary: The buyout comes less than three months after India’s largest IT services firm stated it would invest $6.5 billion over six years to build 1GW of data centre capacity

items.title: Indian stocks are expected to stay expensive: HSBC report
items.summary: Research analysts across the market still maintain that earnings need to trim to reflect the tepid earnings of corporate India or the latter should grow up to justify the valuations

items.title: Tata Steel board greenlights domestic expansion, moves to secure iron ore
items.summary: Tata Steel Ltd's board approved several expansion initiatives, including a 4.8 mtpa capacity increase at Neelachal Ispat Nigam and a new hot-rolling line in Tarapur. The company aims for 40 mtpa capacity by 2030 and has secured a 50.01% stake in Thriveni Pellets for iron ore production.

items.summary: India is urged to be cautious in trade talks with the US, particularly regarding agricultural and GMO products, and to demand significant tariff cuts on its exports. A think tank advises delaying commitments until the US Supreme Court rules on tariff authority.

items.title: Pfizer layoffs: Pharma giant to cut hundreds of jobs in this country to reduce costs
items.summary: Pfizer layoffs: Pharma giant Pfizer is set to cut hundreds of jobs in Switzerland as part of the company's multi-year cost reduction program. Here's how many jobs the company plans to cut by the end of 2025.

items.title: Akasa Air expands its fleet to 31 aircrafts; new plane arrives at Bengaluru International Airport
items.summary: Akasa Air welcomed its 31st aircraft, a Boeing 737 MAX 8-200, featuring advanced Safran Z200 seats with enhanced comfort and connectivity. This delivery marks a significant step in the airline's expansion, reflecting its commitment to passenger experience and sustainability. Akasa Air plans to induct 195 more aircraft in the coming years.

items.summary: Zee Laboratories' drugs face persistent quality issues, with over 86 failed regulatory tests in India and abroad. Despite multiple prosecutions for substandard medicines, the company has seen no convictions. Regulators continue issuing public warnings about the potential dangers of these widely distributed drugs.

items.title: DGCA officials to conduct on-site inspections of IndiGo operations across 11 airports
items.summary: DGCA officials are conducting on-site inspections at 11 domestic airports to assess IndiGo's operations amid widespread disruptions. These inspections aim to evaluate safety, operational preparedness, and passenger facilitation measures. items.summary: IndiGo is bringing in an external technical expert to investigate recent operational issues.  The airline experienced widespread cancellations and delays earlier this month.  Chairman Vikram Singh Mehta has apologized to affected customers.  The investigation will cover all aspects of the disruptions.  Corrective actions will be taken to prevent future occurrences.  IndiGo assures that safety and compliance with rules were maintained.

items.summary: President Trump's accusations of India "dumping" rice in the U.S. market appear politically motivated, aimed at appeasing American farmers hurt by his tariff wars.  Despite the trade's small scale, the move signals pressure to address rural discontent ahead of crucial elections.

items.summary: Elon Musk announced his readiness to serve India via Starlink, following a meeting between SpaceX's senior leadership and Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia. The terminal aims to boost regional connectivity and trade.

Both nations aim to finalize a mutually beneficial pact. This is crucial as the US has imposed steep tariffs on Indian goods. Negotiations are progressing towards a bilateral trade agreement.

items.summary: The facility will offer plug-and-play facilities for the aerospace, automotive, pharmaceutical, and e-commerce sectors

items.summary: India is actively pursuing trade pacts, sharing draft terms for a Free Trade Agreement with Qatar and finalizing internal approvals for a similar deal with Oman. items.summary: While onboarding still requires an India-based location, re-KYC for existing NRI clients can now be done from abroad

items.title: Cipla launches drug for obesity, diabetes
items.summary: Cipla has launched Yurpeak, a new injectable medication for obesity and type-2 diabetes. This one-weekly therapy, tirzepatide, is now available in India. Yurpeak aims to address two significant health challenges in the country. Cipla is collaborating with Eli Lilly for this innovative treatment. The drug will be offered in multiple strengths.

items.summary: Mehta, former chairman at YES Bank and Punjab National Bank, steered IndusInd through its leadership crisis earlier which unfolded after the bank reported discrepancies in its derivatives portfolio which led to around Rs 2,000 crore impact on balance sheet.

items.summary: Indian Railways is launching its first hydrogen train, which showcases new hydrogen-powered train technology. The train, designed and built in India, is the world's longest and most powerful on a broad-gauge platform. It produces zero CO2 emissions, releasing only water vapor.

items.title: Indian silver prices gain ₹7,457 a kg on strong demand, short-supply
items.summary: Tighter global inventories, decade-low Chinese stockpiles, and elevated borrowing costs in London have intensified the supply squeeze, amplifying price momentum.

Officials recommend exploring asset classes like inventory and capital asset financing to enhance stability and economic contribution. This push aims to move NBFC-MFIs from single-product offerings to comprehensive micro-enterprise finance solutions.

items.summary: RCom was seeking a partial repayment of the  ₹550 crore that Reliance Group paid Ericsson in 2019 to purge a Supreme Court contempt order for repeatedly defaulting on its dues to the Swedish company.

items.summary: Piyush Goyal remains optimistic about US trade negotiations, mentioning productive talks and future meetings. Despite challenges from US tariffs, discussions on a Bilateral Trade Agreement continue, with multiple rounds held to enhance India-US economic relations.
